energy.usef.core.util

Class DateTimeUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • energy.usef.core.util.DateTimeUtil

  • public class DateTimeUtil
extends Object
    This utility class provides methods to work with dates.

    • Method Detail

      • updateSettings

        public static boolean updateSettings(String serverIp,
                                     Integer port)
        Set the ip and port of the application. Returns true or false whether it is succesfully using the new settings. In case of incorrect parameters, default time will be used. If time and timefactor cannot be retrieved the system will shut down.
        Parameters:
        serverIp - - The server IP of the usef-time server.
        port - - The server port of the usef-time server.
        Returns:
        - true if succesfull.

      • getElapsedMinutesSinceMidnight

        public static Integer getElapsedMinutesSinceMidnight(org.joda.time.LocalDateTime dateTime)
        Calculate the number of minutes from midnight to now. The number of minutes depends on summer- and winter time.
        Parameters:
        dateTime - the date time which includes the timezone. When setting the DateTime with the default constructor, the default timezone where the application runs, is used.
        Returns:
        the number of minutes from midnight.

      • getMinutesOfDay

        public static Integer getMinutesOfDay(org.joda.time.LocalDate date)
        Calculate the number of minutes of a specific date. Only the date part (year, month and day) is used to calculate the number of minutes. The number of minutes is calculated from midnight to midnight the next day. For a default day this method return 24 * 60 = 1440. If on this day a summer- or wintertime switch occurs, the number of minutes are different.
        Parameters:
        date - the date time which includes the timezone. When setting the DateTime with the default constructor, the default timezone where the application runs, is used.
        Returns:
        the number of minutes for the day (date part) of the dateTime parameter.

      • getCurrentDateWithTime

        public static org.joda.time.LocalDateTime getCurrentDateWithTime(org.joda.time.LocalTime time)
        This method gets the current DateTime, but updates the time given as a paramater.
        Parameters:
        time - - The time to be set.
        Returns:
        An update LocalDateTime with the current Date and the requested time.

      • generateDatesOfInterval

        public static List<org.joda.time.LocalDate> generateDatesOfInterval(org.joda.time.LocalDate startDate,
                                                                    org.joda.time.LocalDate endDate)
        Generates a list with all the dates between a given interal of days.
        Parameters:
        startDate - LocalDate starting date of the sequence (inclusive).
        endDate - LocalDate ending date of the sequence (inclusive).
        Returns:
        a List of LocalDate.
